about.title1: Hi! I'm Matias Larralde and I'm honored that you have a look on my Portfolio.
about.sentence1: I'm coming into the tech industry with a really varied background, from restoration, event setup or even urban farming.
about.sentence2: I grew a lot as a human being through these experiences and I'm glad to have acquired many skills that I can use into Web Development.
about.sentence3: Solving problems and building solutions, on my own or with teammates; as much as having a creative mindset and a strong attention to detail; are skills that become part of me now !
about.sentence4: That builds my thirst for learning and mastering new technologies, coding languages or frameworks. Each new day is a new challenge !
about.sentence5: I know I found my path into coding.

booki.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 2
booki.description: This was my first project where I had to turn a mockup into a responsive web page using HTML and CSS, including mobile, tablet, and desktop versions. I ensured web semantics, compatibility with Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, and code validity with W3C HTML and CSS validators.

sophie-bluel.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 3
sophie-bluel.description: For this project, I used JavaScript to implement several features, such as dynamically fetching data from an API and filtering it. I also integrated a login page and a modal that allows to add, modify, and delete data, both on the page and on the API.

qwenta.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 4
qwenta.description: This project is the only one that does not contain any code, consisting of the planning of website development. Therefore, I wrote the technical specifications, researched various technical aspects of the project, and set up a Kanban board for project management.

nina-carducci.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 5
nina-carducci.description: For this project, I had to optimize the website's images, code, and structure. I also debugged the site's functionalities that were not working and added local SEO and social media integration using meta tags and Schema.org.

kasa.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 6
kasa.description: For this React project, I used React Router to configure page navigation, created React components for different pages, added CSS animations with SASS, and implemented a 404 page for non-existent routes.

mon-vieux-grimoire.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 7
mon-vieux-grimoire.description: This was the last project of my OpenClassrooms training with a roadmap. This time, I built an Express server, a RESTful API, set up an authentication system, and implemented CRUD operations securely.

my-portfolio.title: OpenClassrooms - Project 8
my-portfolio.description: This portfolio was my first independent project from start to finish. I initialized it with Vite and learned new technologies such as TypeScript and Tailwind. I implemented important features to me such as the translation with the i18n library; as well as the modal that provides details on each project I built during my training.
my-portfolio.website-link: You already are on my portfolio !
